DataElement.preferredName: Patient Heart Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating the patient has a heart disease or disorder that meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Heart Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood)._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Heart Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of sustained ventricular tachycardia (VT), ventricular fibrillation (VF), torsades de pointes, or resuscitated cardiac arrest unless currently addressed with an implanted cardiac defibrillator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of long QTc syndrome or ventricular arrhythmias?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of long QTc syndrome or personal or family history of ventricular arrhythmias?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of arrhythmia requiring an implantable cardiac defibrillator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myocardial infarction less than or equal to 6 months or congestive heart failure requiring use of ongoing maintenance therapy for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any clinically important abnormalities in rhythm, conduction or morphology of resting ECG (e.g., complete left bundle branch block, third degree heart block, second degree heart block)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of Torsades de pointes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of clinically significant ventricular arrhythmias (e.g., ventricular tachycardia, ventricular fibrillation, torsade de pointes)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any clinically important abnormalities in rhythm, conduction or morphology of resting electrocardiograms (ECGs), e.g. complete left bundle branch block, third degree heart block, second degree heart block, or PR interval greater than 250 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of polymorphic ventricular fibrillation or torsade de pointes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to fist dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have personal history of any of the following conditions: syncope of cardiovascular etiology, ventricular arrhythmia of pathological origin (including, but not limited to, ventricular tachycardia and ventricular fibrillation), or sudden cardiac arrest?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant conduction abnormalities or arrhythmias?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active ischemic heart disease or heart failure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of arrhythmia requiring and implantable cardiac defibrillator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of Torsade's de pointes (TdP), have all risk factors that contributed to TdP been corrected?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is cardiac ejection fraction greater than or equal to 45% or shortening fraction greater than or equal to 28%, no evidence of physiologically significant pericardial effusion as determined by an ECHO and no clinically significant ECG findings?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a medical history of myocardial infarction within 6 months before enrollment (study treatment), symptomatic congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association Class II to IV, corrected QT interval (QTcF) prolongation to more than 470 ms (females) or 450 ms (males) as corrected by Framingham's formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a medical history of myocardial infarction within 6 months before enrollment, or symptomatic congestive heart failure (CHF) (New York Heart Association Class II to IV)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a personal history of any of the following conditions: syncope of cardiovascular etiology, ventricular arrhythmia of pathological origin (including, but not limited to, ventricular tachycardia and ventricular fibrillation), or sudden cardiac arrest?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a cardiac ejection fraction greater than or equal to 45% or shortening fraction greater than or equal to 28%, no evidence of physiologically significant pericardial effusion as determined by an ECHO, MUGA or Cardiac MRI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant ECG findings?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.2 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002682. ak 8/5/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
